publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-3618 Shirley-Anne Somerville: Campaign for the Release of Binayak Sen—That the Parliament welcomes the visit to Scotland of Indian human rights campaigner Illina Sen on Monday 9 March 2009; notes that her husband, Binayak Sen, has been jailed in India since May 2007; recognises that Amnesty International considers his jail sentence to be unacceptable and politically motivated; notes that Binayak Sen is a medical doctor who has devoted decades of his life to working with poor people in central India, and welcomes the work done by the Free Binayak Sen Campaign to condemn attempts to silence peaceful campaigns for justice and equality.

S3M-3618 Shirley-Anne Somerville: Campaign for the Release of Binayak Sen—That the Parliament welcomes the visit to Scotland of Indian human rights campaigner Illina Sen on Monday 9 March 2009; notes that her husband, Binayak Sen, has been jailed in India since May 2007; recognises that Amnesty International considers his jail sentence to be unacceptable and politically motivated; notes that Binayak Sen is a medical doctor who has devoted decades of his life to working with poor people in central India, and welcomes the work done by the Free Binayak Sen Campaign to condemn attempts to silence peaceful campaigns for justice and equality. Supported by: Kenneth Gibson*, Christopher Harvie*, Joe FitzPatrick*, Bill Kidd*, Rob Gibson*, Bill Wilson*, Anne McLaughlin*
S3M-3618 Campaign for the Release of Binayak Sen (lodged on 5 March 2009) Christina McKelvie*, Marlyn Glen*, Robert Brown*, Sandra White*, Malcolm Chisholm*, Liam McArthur*, Trish Godman*
S3M-3618 Campaign for the Release of Binayak Sen (lodged on 5 March 2009) Jamie Hepburn*
S3M-3618 Campaign for the Release of Binayak Sen (lodged on 5 March 2009) Robin Harper*
S3M-3618 Campaign for the Release of Binayak Sen (lodged on 5 March 2009) Stuart McMillan*, Gil Paterson*
S3M-3618 Campaign for the Release of Binayak Sen (lodged on 5 March 2009) Angela Constance*
S3M-3618 Campaign for the Release of Binayak Sen (lodged on 5 March 2009) Ken Macintosh*, Patrick Harvie*
S3M-3618 Campaign for the Release of Binayak Sen (lodged on 5 March 2009) Mike Pringle*, Ian McKee*
S3M-3618 Campaign for the Release of Binayak Sen (lodged on 5 March 2009) Pauline McNeill*
